member.name: M:DDay.iCal.IGetOccurrences.GetOccurrences(DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary:
Returns all occurrences of this component that start on the date provided. All components starting between 12:00:00AM and 11:59:59 PM will be returned.
This will first Evaluate() the date range required in order to determine the occurrences for the date provided, and then return the occurrences.
member.param: The date for which to return occurrences.
member.returns: A list of Periods representing the occurrences of this object.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.IGetOccurrences.GetOccurrences(DDay.iCal.IDateTime,DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary: Returns all occurrences of this component that start within the date range provided. All components occurring between and will be returned.
member.param: The starting date range
The ending date range

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.ITodo.IsCompleted(DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary:
Use this method to determine if a todo item has been completed. This takes into account recurrence items and the previous date of completion, if any.
This method evaluates the recurrence pattern for this TODO as necessary to ensure all relevant information is taken into account to give the most accurate result possible.
member.param: The date and time to test.
member.returns: True if the todo item has been completed

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.ITodo.IsActive(DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary: Returns 'True' if the todo item is Active as of . An item is Active if it requires action of some sort.
member.param: The date and time to test.
member.returns: True if the item is Active as of , False otherwise.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.ITodo.IsCancelled
member.summary: Returns True if the todo item was cancelled.
member.returns: True if the todo was cancelled, False otherwise.

Add support for the Related property
Create a TextCollection DataType for 'text' items separated by commas

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvent.DTEnd
member.summary:
The end date/time of the event.
If the duration has not been set, but the start/end time of the event is available, the duration is automatically determined. Likewise, if an end time and duration are available, but a start time has not been set, the start time will be extrapolated.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvent.Duration
member.summary:
The duration of the event.
If a start time and duration is available, the end time is automatically determined. Likewise, if the end time and duration is available, but a start time is not determined, the start time will be extrapolated from available information.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvent.End
member.summary: An alias to the DTEnd field (i.e. end date/time).

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvent.IsAllDay
member.summary: Returns true if the event is an all-day event.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvent.GeographicLocation
member.summary: The geographic location (lat/long) of the event.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvent.Location
member.summary: The location of the event.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvent.Resources
member.summary: Resources that will be used during the event. Conference room #2 Projector

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvent.Status
member.summary: The status of the event.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvent.Transparency
member.summary: The transparency of the event. In other words, whether or not the period of time this event occupies can contain other events (transparent), or if the time cannot be scheduled for anything else (opaque).

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.Event.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an Event object, with an (usually an iCalendar object) as its parent.
member.param: An , usually an iCalendar object.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.Event.OccursOn(DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary:
Use this method to determine if an event occurs on a given date.
This event should be called only after the method has calculated the dates for which this event occurs.
member.param: The date to test.
member.returns: True if the event occurs on the provided, False otherwise.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.Event.OccursAt(DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary: Use this method to determine if an event begins at a given date and time.
member.param: The date and time to test.
member.returns: True if the event begins at the given date and time

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.Event.IsActive
member.summary: Determines whether or not the is actively displayed as an upcoming or occurred event.
member.returns: True if the event has not been cancelled, False otherwise.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.Event.DTStart
member.summary:
The start date/time of the event.
If the duration has not been set, but the start/end time of the event is available, the duration is automatically determined. Likewise, if the end date/time has not been set, but a start and duration are available, the end date/time will be extrapolated.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.Event.DTEnd
member.summary:
The end date/time of the event.
If the duration has not been set, but the start/end time of the event is available, the duration is automatically determined. Likewise, if an end time and duration are available, but a start time has not been set, the start time will be extrapolated.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.Event.Duration
member.summary:
The duration of the event.
If a start time and duration is available, the end time is automatically determined. Likewise, if the end time and duration is available, but a start time is not determined, the start time will be extrapolated from available information.

member.summary: An alias to the DTEnd field (i.e. end date/time).

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.Event.IsAllDay
member.summary: Returns true if the event is an all-day event.

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.GeographicLocation
member.summary: A class that represents the geographical location of an or item.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.IEvaluator.Clear
member.summary: Clears the evaluation, eliminating all data that has been collected up to this point. Since this data is cached as needed, this method can be useful to gather information that is guaranteed to not be out-of-date.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.IEvaluator.Evaluate(DDay.iCal.IDateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Evaluates this item to determine the dates and times for which it occurs/recurs. This method only evaluates items which occur/recur between and ; therefore, if you require a list of items which occur outside of this range, you must specify a and which encapsulate the date(s) of interest. This method evaluates using the as the beginning point. For example, for a WEEKLY occurrence, the determines the day of week that this item will recur on.
For events with very complex recurrence rules, this method may be a bottleneck during processing time, especially when this method is called for a large number of items, in sequence, or for a very large time span.
member.param: The date to begin evaluation from.
The beginning date of the range to evaluate.
The end date of the range to evaluate.
member.returns: A list of objects for each date/time when this item occurs/recurs.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvaluator.Calendar
member.summary: The system calendar that governs the evaluation rules.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvaluator.EvaluationStartBounds
member.summary: The start bounds of the evaluation. This gives the first date/time that is covered by the evaluation. This together with EvaluationEndBounds determines what time frames have already been evaluated, so duplicate evaluation doesn't occur.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvaluator.EvaluationEndBounds
member.summary: The end bounds of the evaluation. See for more info.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvaluator.Periods
member.summary: Gets a list of periods collected so far during the evaluation process.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.IEvaluator.AssociatedObject
member.summary: Gets the object associated with this evaluator.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.RecurringEvaluator.EvaluateRRule(DDay.iCal.IDateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Evaulates the RRule component, and adds each specified Period to the collection.
member.param: The beginning date of the range to evaluate.
The end date of the range to evaluate.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.RecurringEvaluator.EvaluateRDate(DDay.iCal.IDateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Evalates the RDate component, and adds each specified DateTime or Period to the collection.
member.param: The beginning date of the range to evaluate.
The end date of the range to evaluate.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.TextUtil.Normalize(System.String,DDay.iCal.Serialization.ISerializationContext)
member.summary:
Normalizes line endings, converting "" into "
" and "
" into "
".

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.TextUtil.UnwrapLines(System.String)
member.summary: Unwraps lines from the RFC 2445 "line folding" technique. NOTE: this method makes the line/col numbers output from antlr incorrect.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.EventEvaluator.Evaluate(DDay.iCal.IDateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Evaluates this event to determine the dates and times for which the event occurs. This method only evaluates events which occur between and ; therefore, if you require a list of events which occur outside of this range, you must specify a and which encapsulate the date(s) of interest.
For events with very complex recurrence rules, this method may be a bottleneck during processing time, especially when this method in called for a large number of events, in sequence, or for a very large time span.
member.param: The beginning date of the range to evaluate.
The end date of the range to evaluate.

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.iCalendar
member.summary:
A class that represents an iCalendar object. To load an iCalendar object, generally a static LoadFromXXX method is used.
For example, use the following code to load an iCalendar object from a URL:
IICalendar iCal = iCalendar.LoadFromUri(new Uri("http://somesite.com/calendar.ics"));
Once created, an iCalendar object can be used to gathers relevant information about events, todos, time zones, journal entries, and free/busy time.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.IICalendar.Create``1
member.summary: Creates a new component, and adds it to the calendar.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.IICalendar.GetTimeZone(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the time zone object that corresponds to the provided TZID, or null of no matching time zone could be found.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.IICalendar.AddTimeZone(System.TimeZoneInfo)
member.summary: Adds a system time zone to the iCalendar. This time zone may then be used in date/time objects contained in the calendar.
member.param: A System.TimeZoneInfo object to add to the calendar.
member.returns: The time zone added to the calendar.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.IICalendar.AddLocalTimeZone
member.summary: Adds the local system time zone to the iCalendar. This time zone may then be used in date/time objects contained in the calendar.
member.returns: The time zone added to the calendar.

member.summary: Gets/sets the calendar method.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.iCalendar.Evaluate(DDay.iCal.IDateTime,DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary:
Evaluates component recurrences for the given range of time.
For example, if you are displaying a month-view for January 2007, you would want to evaluate recurrences for Jan. 1, 2007 to Jan. 31, 2007 to display relevant information for those dates.
member.param: The beginning date/time of the range to test.
The end date/time of the range to test.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.iCalendar.Evaluate``1(DDay.iCal.IDateTime,DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary: Evaluates component recurrences for the given range of time, for the type of recurring component specified.
member.typeparam: The type of component to be evaluated for recurrences.
member.param: The beginning date/time of the range to test.
The end date/time of the range to test.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.iCalendar.ClearEvaluation
member.summary: Clears recurrence evaluations for recurring components.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.iCalendar.GetOccurrences(DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary: Returns a list of occurrences of each recurring component for the date provided ().
member.param: The date for which to return occurrences. Time is ignored on this parameter.
member.returns: A list of occurrences that occur on the given date ().

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.iCalendar.GetOccurrences(DDay.iCal.IDateTime,DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary: Returns a list of occurrences of each recurring component that occur between and .
member.param: The beginning date/time of the range.
The end date/time of the range.
member.returns: A list of occurrences that fall between the dates provided.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.iCalendar.GetOccurrences``1(DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary:
Returns all occurrences of components of type T that start on the date provided. All components starting between 12:00:00AM and 11:59:59 PM will be returned.
This will first Evaluate() the date range required in order to determine the occurrences for the date provided, and then return the occurrences.
member.param: The date for which to return occurrences.
member.returns: A list of Periods representing the occurrences of this object.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.iCalendar.GetOccurrences``1(DDay.iCal.IDateTime,DDay.iCal.IDateTime)
member.summary: Returns all occurrences of components of type T that start within the date range provided. All components occurring between and will be returned.
member.param: The starting date range
The ending date range

member.returns: An object of the type specified

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.RecurrencePatternEvaluator
member.summary:
Much of this code comes from iCal4j, as Ben Fortuna has done an excellent job with the recurrence pattern evaluation there.
Here's the iCal4j license: ================== iCal4j - License ==================
Copyright (c) 2009, Ben Fortuna All rights reserved.

o Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.
o Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
o Neither the name of Ben Fortuna nor the names of any other contributors may be used to endorse or promote products derived from this software without specific prior written permission.
THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT OWNER OR CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.

members.member: Returns a list of start dates in the specified period represented by this recur. This method includes a base date argument, which indicates the start of the fist occurrence of this recurrence. The base date is used to inject default values to return a set of dates in the correct format. For example, if the search start date (start) is Wed, Mar 23, 12:19PM, but the recurrence is Mon - Fri, 9:00AM - 5:00PM, the start dates returned should all be at 9:00AM, and not 12:19PM.

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.EventStatus
member.summary: Status codes available to an item

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.TodoStatus
member.summary: Status codes available to a item.

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.JournalStatus
member.summary: Status codes available to a entry.

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.FrequencyOccurrence
F:DDay.iCal.RecurrenceRestrictionType.Default
member.summary: Same as RestrictSecondly.

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.RecurrenceRestrictionType.NoRestriction
member.summary: Does not restrict recurrence evaluation - WARNING: this may cause very slow performance!

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.RecurrenceRestrictionType.RestrictSecondly
member.summary: Disallows use of the SECONDLY frequency for recurrence evaluation

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.RecurrenceRestrictionType.RestrictMinutely
member.summary: Disallows use of the MINUTELY and SECONDLY frequencies for recurrence evaluation

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.RecurrenceRestrictionType.RestrictHourly
member.summary: Disallows use of the HOURLY, MINUTELY, and SECONDLY frequencies for recurrence evaluation

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.RecurrenceEvaluationModeType.Default
member.summary: Same as ThrowException.

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.RecurrenceEvaluationModeType.AdjustAutomatically
member.summary: Automatically adjusts the evaluation to the next-best frequency based on the restriction type. For example, if the restriction were IgnoreSeconds, and the frequency were SECONDLY, then this would cause the frequency to be adjusted to MINUTELY, the next closest thing.

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.RecurrenceEvaluationModeType.ThrowException
member.summary: This will throw an exception if a recurrence rule is evaluated that does not meet the minimum restrictions. For example, if the restriction were IgnoreSeconds, and a SECONDLY frequency were evaluated, an exception would be thrown.

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.CalendarMethods.Publish
member.summary: Used to publish an iCalendar object to one or more "Calendar Users". There is no interactivity between the publisher and any other "Calendar User". An example might include a baseball team publishing its schedule to the public.

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.CalendarMethods.Request
member.summary: Used to schedule an iCalendar object with other "Calendar Users". Requests are interactive in that they require the receiver to respond using the reply methods. Meeting requests, busy-time requests, and the assignment of tasks to other "Calendar Users" are all examples. Requests are also used by the Organizer to update the status of an iCalendar object.

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.CalendarMethods.Reply
member.summary: A reply is used in response to a request to convey Attendee status to the Organizer. Replies are commonly used to respond to meeting and task requests.

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.CalendarMethods.Add
member.summary: Add one or more new instances to an existing recurring iCalendar object.

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.CalendarMethods.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel one or more instances of an existing iCalendar object.

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.CalendarMethods.Refresh
member.summary: Used by an Attendee to request the latest version of an iCalendar object.

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.CalendarMethods.Counter
member.summary: Used by an Attendee to negotiate a change in an iCalendar object. Examples include the request to change a proposed event time or change the due date for a task.

member.name: F:DDay.iCal.CalendarMethods.DeclineCounter
member.summary: Used by the Organizer to decline the proposed counter-proposal.

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.RecurringComponentDateSorter
member.summary: Sorts recurring components by their start dates

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.Journal
member.summary: A class that represents an RFC 5545 VJOURNAL component.

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.Serialization.iCalendar.ComponentPropertyConsolidator
member.summary: FIXME: implement this.

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.WeekDay
member.summary: Represents an RFC 5545 "BYDAY" value.

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.RequestStatus
member.summary: A class that represents the return status of an iCalendar request.

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.CalendarProperty
member.summary: A class that represents a property of the itself or one of its components. It can also represent non-standard (X-) properties of an iCalendar component, as seen with many applications, such as with Apple's iCal. X-WR-CALNAME:US Holidays
member.remarks:
Currently, the "known" properties for an iCalendar are as follows:
ProdID
Version
CalScale
Method
There may be other, custom X-properties applied to the calendar, and X-properties may be applied to calendar components.

member.name: M:DDay.iCal.CalendarProperty.AddParameter(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a parameter to the iCalendar object.

member.summary: Adds a parameter to the iCalendar object.

member.name: P:DDay.iCal.CalendarProperty.Parameters
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters that are associated with the iCalendar object.

member.name: T:DDay.iCal.CalendarObjectList
member.summary: A collection of calendar objects.
